title: Album Page, "Black Forest Sketches", September 18, 1887
medium: Graphite, on cream wove paper tipped into binding with fabric
markings: Paper-maker's mark: embossed in support at upper left corner of sheet: an oval with "J M P" in center, ornament above and a small banner that reads "BRISTOL" below.
inscribed: Recto, in graphite, at top left: steeple on / village church; at top right: House in Gagenauu [sic]; in top right corner: (inscribed in circle) 47 / 59; at center: little roof dormer; at lower left: Very pretty form of gables / overhang in both studs / is at least 3 ft.; lower left edge: Black Forest Sketches / Sept 18th 1887; at right: shingle / bell cupola / even more top / heavy than this / very pretty / Gaggenau / Sept 18th 1887 / the letters simply... were gilded.
description: Vertical sheet with frayed bottom and right edge.  Illustrated are sketches of buildings and architectural features.  Beginning from top left are two domed steeples, both with shingled onion-shaped cupolas and tall finials. At right is an elevation of a timbered building with a large, deep gable on both stories which shade open windows with shutters.  In the center is a very small sketch of a dormer within a shingled or tiled roof.  At lower left is likely the same gabled building sketched on the  upper half of the sheet, but now viewed from a corner angle, the gables supported by very large timbers which the artist identifies as being "at least 3 ft."  At lower right is a very quickly sketched tiled or shingled roof with an awkwardly oversize "bell" cupola, as it is named by the artist.  The cupola projects from the roof on a very thin support, and balloons above it.  The cupola is shingled, and terminates in a small ball finial with weathervane.

tombstone.epitaph:
Album Page, "Black Forest Sketches", September 18, 1887.
September 18, 1887. Graphite, on cream wove paper tipped into binding with fabric. Gift of Mrs. William Greenough. 1943-51-127.
